intro: Cenchrus ramosissimus, commonly known as the hairy finger grass, is a perennial grass species native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its丛生 growth habit and slender, hairy stems that often branch profusely. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences with pale green to brown bracts. Its leaves are narrow, linear, and covered with fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Cenchrus ramosissimus is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
